title: #MobilizeBrevard Fit Friday Best Bets: 10/9-11
text:
#MobilizeBrevard Fit Friday Best Bets: 10/9-11 Michelle Mulak , FLORIDA TODAY 5:04 p.m. EDT October 7, 2015 Take it from fitness & water reporter Michelle Mulak, these active weekend adventures should be on your radar 10/9-10/11. Join the movement! Check out #MobilizeBrevardâ€™s coverage in FLORIDA TODAY and floridatoday.com. (Photo: MOBILIZEBREVARD) CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Florida Women of the Waves Weekend: Come celebrate the surfing sisterhood at this two-day event that aims to bring women from across the Florida surfing community together. Event kicks off with a surf movie at the Cocoa Beach Public Library, 550 N. Brevard Ave., at 6:30 p.m. Friday. Saturday's festivities start at 9 a.m. at Lori Wilson Park, 1500 N. Atlantic Ave., Cocoa Beach, with a beach yoga class followed by the famous surfing social. BYOB (as in bring your own board) for this family-friendly event. It wraps up Saturday night with a potluck BBQ at the Cocoa Beach Country Club, 5000 Tom Warriner Blvd. Bring a covered dish and $5. Features include live music by Honey Miller until 10 p.m. Visit floridasurfmuseum.org/events . 
Bob's Bicycle Shop Breast Cancer Ride: Join the gang from Bob's Bicycle Shop, 510 E. Eau Gallie Causeway, Indian Harbour Beach, as they head out for a 10-, 25- or 35-mile bike ride to raise money for breast cancer charities and breast cancer research. Cost is $35 for the 10-miler, $45 for the 25- or 35-mile ride. Road bikes are recommended for 25- and 35-mile rides, all bikes are welcome for the 10-miler. It starts at 7 a.m. Saturday. Call 321-773-2093. This week's #TryThis is a real knockout 
Witch Way 5K: This costume-friendly 5K run and walk is in its eighth year and raises money for several local organizations including Space Coast Volunteers in Medicine and No Limits Academy. Beer samples from Hell & Blazers Brewery in Melbourne will be handed out after the race, and there will be trick-or-treating for the kiddos. Race starts at 5:30 p.m. Saturday at Nance Park in Indialantic with an after-party and awards at Longdoggers in Indialantic. Cost is $20-$32. Call 321-723-2242 or visit witchway5k.com . 
Mulak is the fitness & water reporter for FLORIDA TODAY. 
Contact Mulak at 321-242-3669
